citeinfo.title: transects2_transects_20240313_103955 - Digital Shoreline Analysis System Version 6.0.141 Intersect
Project title
citeinfo.othercit: This metadata record is a template for data created using the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) version 6.0 application. Basic process steps and attribute fields have been described but many required fields have been left blank for the DSAS user to enter their specifications. In particular, the coordinate system is not included, this information can be found in the summary report produced by DSAS. Therefore, this metadata file is not FGDC-compliant as is. The Digital Shoreline Analysis System (version 6) is a desktop application that loads GeoJSON files saved by a Geographic Information System. The DSAS software requires users to import a reference baseline and a set of shoreline positions. DSAS will then generate measurement transects and shoreline intersections which it will use to calculate rate-of-change statistics. In addition, DSAS provides uncertainties associated with rates of change. This metadata file accompanies an intersect file of the same name ([name]_[timestamp]) that was created using the Digital Shoreline Analysis System version 6.0.

idinfo.useconst: These data were automatically generated using the DSAS version 6.0 software application and should only be used for purposes explicitly stated by the originating organization.

citeinfo.title: Digital Shoreline Analysis System version 6.0: U.S. Geological Survey software release

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

citeinfo.title: Digital Shoreline Analysis System (version 5.1) User Guide
citeinfo.othercit: Please use the following citation: Himmelstoss, E.A., Farris, A.S., Henderson, R.E., Kratzmann, M.G., Ergul, A., Zhang, O., Zichichi, J.L., Thieler, E.R., 2018, Digital Shoreline Analysis System (v5): U.S. Geological Survey software

dataqual.logic: These data were generated using DSAS, an automated software program which does not perform checks for fidelity of the input features. Any testing on these data should be carried out by end-users to ensure fidelity of relationships.
dataqual.complete: This dataset contains all the shoreline/transect intersects automatically generated by the rate calculation tool in the DSAS version 6 application. Incomplete fields in the metadata record should be updated by the DSAS user.

procstep.procdesc: Transect features generated using DSAS version 6.0.141. Parameters Used: baseline layer=BaselineTempManTaranaki, baseline group field=FID, transect spacing=500, search distance=2000, baseline placement=Off shore, smoothing distance=500, For additional details on these parameters, please see the DSAS help file distributed with the DSAS software, or visit the USGS DSAS page at: https://woodshole.er.usgs.gov/project-pages/DSAS/

Shoreline intersects and rate calculations performed. Parameters Used: transect file=transects2_transects_20240313_103955, shoreline layer=ShorelinesTempManTaranakiUpdated2, shoreline date field=DSASDATE3, shoreline uncertainty field name=UNCY, the default accuracy=10m, stats calculations=EPR,LRR,NSM,SCE,WLR, shoreline threshold=1, confidence interval=90.0%. Process Date=Âƒ20240313

enttyp.enttypd: The intersection points are generated by DSAS at each transect, where it crosses a shoreline. Intersection points are returned as a GeoJSON file.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: The TransectID relates directly to the original transect file identifier.
Assigned by DSAS based on ordering of transects along the baseline. Allows user to sort transect data sequentially alongshore from baseline start to baseline end.
The date (mm/dd/yyyy) of the shoreline intersected by the transect and represented (for shoreline analysis) by the intersect point.

Values in this field correlate to the baseline attribute field "ID" and are assigned by DSAS to identify the baseline segment used to generate the measurement transect. Baseline segments assigned an ID = 0 are ignored by DSAS and no transects will be cast along those line segments.

The distance in meters between the DSAS reference baseline and the shoreline intersection point along a DSAS transect. If the baseline is offshore, distance values are negative. If the baseline is onshore, distance values are positive.
The X coordinate location of the intersect point.
The Y coordinate location of the intersect point.
The positional uncertainty of the shoreline at the intersect point, as defined by the shoreline positional uncertainty value.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describe the attributes that are generated using the Digital Shoreline Analysis System version 6 software. In some cases, the attributes described in this metadata file may not exist in the dataset. It is up to the DSAS user to verify the attributes and ensure all values are populated with regard to their dataset.

digtinfo.formspec: GeoJSON is an open standard geospatial data interchange format that represents simple geographic features and their nonspatial attributes.
digtinfo.formcont: Based on JavaScript Object Notation (JSON), GeoJSON is a format for encoding a variety of geographic data structures. GeoJSON files can be converted to and from shapefiles in GIS software.
